snippet: Once friends, colleagues and lovers, Rebekah Brooks and Andy Coulson are on trial on charges of illegally intercepting voice messages at The News of the World, but she appears to be faring relatively better.
abstract: Rebekah Brooks and Andy Coulson, once friends, colleagues and lovers, are on trial in London on charges of illegally intercepting voice messages as editors at Rupert Murdoch's defunct The News of the World; Brooks, wealthy from a rich severance package, appears to be faring relatively better than Coulson, who is short of cash and out of work for nearly three years.
lead_paragraph: Once friends, colleagues and lovers, Rebekah Brooks and Andy Coulson are on trial on charges of illegally intercepting voice messages at The News of the World, but she appears to be faring relatively better.

headline.main: Fates of Brooks and Coulson in Tabloid Hacking Case Are Diverging
headline.print_headline: Hacking Defendants, Once Close, Are Diverging

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
